summary: This document is an email chain from June 2019 discussing confirmation from Austrian authorities that Jeffrey Epstein's plane, with him and three female passengers, landed in Vienna on March 22, 2019. The group visited Café Landtmann before departing for Paris later that same evening. The correspondence involves U.S. Marshals and Diplomatic Security Service personnel seeking to confirm and act on this travel information.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Confirmed to have been on his private plane (tail number N212JE) that landed in Vienna, Austria on March 22, 2019, with three female passengers.

persons.name: Poldi
persons.context: Mentioned in the German-language email as the source ("Nach Rücksprache mit Poldi") who provided the flight and passenger information to Austrian authorities.

connections.description: Poldi, a police contact at Vienna Airport, provided flight confirmation and passenger information about Epstein's travel to investigating authorities.
The U.S. Marshals Service agent is investigating and tracking Epstein's international travel movements.

events.title: Epstein's trip to Vienna
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein's private plane (tail number N212JE) landed at Vienna Airport at 5:00 PM. Epstein and three female passengers visited Café Landtmann in Vienna before departing for Paris at 10:00 PM the same day.

events.title: Austrian police provide flight confirmation
events.description: An email from Austrian authorities (citing information from police contact 'Poldi') confirms the details of Epstein's March 22nd arrival and departure from Vienna.

events.title: USMS relays travel confirmation to DSS
events.description: A U.S. Marshals Service Special Agent forwards the confirmed travel information from Austrian authorities to colleagues at the U.S. Department of State's Diplomatic Security Service, asking for guidance on next steps.

keyFacts: Jeffrey Epstein traveled to Vienna, Austria on March 22, 2019, via his private plane (tail number N212JE).
He was accompanied by three unidentified female passengers during this trip.
The group visited the well-known Viennese café, Café Landtmann, during their layover.
The same evening, they departed Vienna for Paris at 10:00 PM.
In June 2019, U.S. law enforcement (U.S. Marshals and Diplomatic Security Service) was actively investigating and confirming details of Epstein's international travel.
